summary: The U.S. Postal Service touches virtually every U.S. household and business and is critical to the national economy. However, it has lost over $78 billion in recent years due to declining mail volumes and rising costs. Businesses and foreign postal organizations that faced similar challenges made significant changes, such as reducing less profitable products and services. title: U.S. Postal Service: Congressional Action Is Essential to Enable a Sustainable Business Model
